title: Magnetic force - force on current-carrying loop

content.description: A current-carrying square loop of wire has side length <math alttext="2 r" overflow="scroll"> <mn>2</mn> <mi>r</mi> </math> and is in the plane of the page . The bottom side of the loop is positioned a distance <math alttext="r" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> away from a long, straight wire, also in the plane of the page, as shown. The long, straight wire carries a current <math alttext="I" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math> directed to the right, and the square loop of wire also carries a current <math alttext="I" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math> that is directed counterclockwise in the loop.
content.question: Which expression is equal to the magnitude of the net magnetic force on the square loop of wire from the long straight wire?
